<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a landmark moment for the US’ recovery from the Covid-19 economic crisis, the Federal Reserve said that it would begin <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/03/business/economy/fed-taper-bond-buying.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reducing its asset purchases</a> by $15 billion/month beginning later in November. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When that program fully runs out next summer, investors expect the Fed to begin hiking interest rates, which are currently near zero. No rate hikes were announced yesterday.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In spring 2020, the Fed unleashed the stimmy to end all stimmies: a $120 billion/month <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/11/03/1051478945/federal-reserve-inflation-jobs-employment?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bond-buying program</a> designed to keep borrowing costs low and help consumers and businesses weather the economic storm. This program, and other relief measures introduced by the government, are credited with keeping the economy afloat and spurring a faster-than-expected economic recovery.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as the economy regained its footing, another menace has emerged: inflation. A medley of factors, including supply chain bottlenecks and roaring consumer demand for goods, has driven prices higher than the Fed, or really anyone going shopping, would like.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In September, consumer prices grew by 4.4% annually, compared to the Fed’s 2% target.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>US gas prices averaged $3.40/gallon as of last Saturday, up from $2.14 a year ago.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Concerned that higher inflation could become its own drag on the economy, central bankers decided it’s time to wind down the stimulus and hope that prices come back down to Earth.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The Great Unwinding isn’t a US solo album. Central bankers from Australia to Canada have already begun to roll back their pandemic-era stimulus measures as the global economy heals and inflation becomes a threat. Today, the Bank of England could become the first major central bank to raise interest rates following the recession.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/03/finance-firms-join-group-to-deploy-private-capital-in-climate-flight?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Finance Comes to the Planet's Rescue, Maybe
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Can you save the Earth and make a whole lot of dough while doing it? We’re about to find out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than 450 major financial firms have <a href="https://apnews.com/article/climate-science-business-europe-environment-and-nature-cb368ade2c379ebd616c49e90e3f6b87?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed on</a> to the Glasgow Financial Alliance for Net Zero, which abbreviates to the much jollier GFANZ.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The aim is to funnel the alliance’s collective $130 trillion in assets (representing 40% of the world’s capital) into projects that help the globe reach the target set out by the Paris agreement of limiting warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GFANZ is led by former central banker and current UN Climate Envoy Mark Carney, and it will be co-chaired by Mike Bloomberg.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it will work: </strong>Because loads of private capital will have to be deployed to help fund the next, say, Tesla. “The gap between what governments have and what the world needs is large,” Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it won’t work: </strong>Environmental nonprofits have hit GFANZ members for being climate hypocrites, saying that donning a cape doesn’t make you a superhero. For instance, global banks have poured <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-02/carney-s-climate-alliance-crests-130-trillion-as-pledges-soar?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$4 trillion</a> into gas, oil, and coal projects since the 2015 Paris agreement, according to Bloomberg.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUPS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/03/us-based-women-founded-startups-raised-more-usd40-billion-so-far-in-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
VCs to Women: Whoa, Forgot About You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/03/us-based-women-founded-startups-raised-more-usd40-billion-so-far-in-2021?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="US venture capital raised by female-founded companies slowly rising from 2010. 2021 amount over $40 billion, 2020 just over $20 billion" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6b164fca09fc8f8b2a55ea34e8706b0b017469c1-1500x844.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US-based startups with one or more female founders <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/11/03/female-founders-are-making-a-buzzing-venture-backed-comeback/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a> $40 billion in the first three quarters of 2021, almost double the amount raised in all of 2020 or 2019, according to a new report from PitchBook.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s also been a record year for women to sell their companies or take them public. Through September, female-founded companies recorded $59 billion in exits.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus, the greatest number of women-led startups hit unicorn status in 2021.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is a hard pivot from last year. Despite the record amount invested by VCs in 2020, female-founded startups saw drops in the number of deals (down 2%) and investment dollars (3%) that closed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So, what changed?</strong> Did VC funds wake up on January 1 and remember women can run businesses? Prolly not. One indicator might be who’s writing the checks: As of September, roughly 15.4% of general partners at VC firms were women, up from 12% in 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Before you start blasting “Fight Song,” female-founded startups only nabbed about 18% of the $239 billion VC firms shelled out through September.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/03/key-performance-indicators-november-4?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/03/key-performance-indicators-november-4?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Wayward balloon soaring over Los Angeles" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7aaf976896f70d3f54cc215f4999460ce98b0d73-1024x683.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>KTLA</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “One working theory is that pilots might have seen balloons.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An FAA spokesperson thinks authorities may have <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/03/us/la-jetpack-sighting-balloon.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">finally figured out</a> what’s behind the curious sightings of a “jetpack guy” flying high above Los Angeles over the last year. Authorities are guessing it could be a large inflatable balloon, one that resembles <em>The Nightmare Before Christmas </em>character Jack Skellington.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Baleen whales, which include humpback, blue, and minke whales, <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/11/03/1051650199/the-biggest-whales-can-eat-the-equivalent-of-80-000-big-macs-in-one-day?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eat more</a> than The Rock could ever dream of, according to a new study in <em>Nature</em>. Their diet of 10–20 tons of food a day is equivalent to about 70,000–80,000 Big Macs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Why everyone is wrong about the metaverse. (<a href="https://twitter.com/ShaanVP/status/1454151237650112512?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Shaan Puri</a>)</p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/03/group-of-investors-purchase-tungsten-cube-for-usd250-000?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You’re So Dense
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/03/group-of-investors-purchase-tungsten-cube-for-usd250-000?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A tungsten cube" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/009dd41ae8786537cb808a49fb56cfc68e9b447c-1536x884.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://twitter.com/zerobeta/status/1454097632666734597?">Justin Paterno</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Crypto investors mean that as a compliment of the highest order. Their growing obsession with cubes of tungsten, a material admired for its tightly packed particle structure, hit a new high this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened:</strong> A group of investors called the TungstenDAO purchased an NFT of a 2-ton (but just over 14 dainty inches) tungsten cube for 56.9 ether, or about $250,000. The NFT comes with the right to visit the cube <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/11/3/22761305/tungsten-cube-meme-nft-crypto-midwest?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">once a year</a> in its private storage room at the Illinois headquarters of its manufacturer, Midwest Tungsten Service.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">From metal → meme</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Midwest Tungsten Service makes tungsten for industrial uses, but <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/cryptocurrency-enthusiasts-are-obsessed-dense-tungsten-cubes-rcna4283?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">started selling</a> small cubes of the metal in 2015 as desktop knickknacks. That soon evolved into a meme when ridiculous <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/copypasta/comments/eyqwn9/tungsten_cube_amazon_review/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Amazon reviews</a> piled up exalting the “intensity of its density.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then, this year, influential crypto investors like Coin Center’s Director of Communications Neeraj K. Agrawal went full magpie on the metal. A few tweets later and Midwest Tungsten Service’s Amazon store sold out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This is silly, but we’re not going to underestimate how much value a meme can generate after GameStop, shiba inu coin, etc.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Great Unwinding Has Arrived\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/03/in-long-awaited-announcement-the-fed-says-it-ll-wind-down-its-bond-buying-program?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Lord of the Rings character saying \"And so it begins\" \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=280 --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt='Lord of the Rings character saying \"And so it begins\" ' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-03/image-6cf32a9dffb00c1c78c7ad6707cd52469215419a-480x200-gif/soitbegins.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a landmark moment for the US’ recovery from the Covid-19 economic crisis, the Federal Reserve said that it would begin \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/03/business/economy/fed-taper-bond-buying.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereducing its asset purchases\u003c/a\u003e by $15 billion/month beginning later in November. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen that program fully runs out next summer, investors expect the Fed to begin hiking interest rates, which are currently near zero. No rate hikes were announced yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn spring 2020, the Fed unleashed the stimmy to end all stimmies: a $120 billion/month \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/11/03/1051478945/federal-reserve-inflation-jobs-employment?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebond-buying program\u003c/a\u003e designed to keep borrowing costs low and help consumers and businesses weather the economic storm. This program, and other relief measures introduced by the government, are credited with keeping the economy afloat and spurring a faster-than-expected economic recovery.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as the economy regained its footing, another menace has emerged: inflation. A medley of factors, including supply chain bottlenecks and roaring consumer demand for goods, has driven prices higher than the Fed, or really anyone going shopping, would like.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn September, consumer prices grew by 4.4% annually, compared to the Fed’s 2% target.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUS gas prices averaged $3.40/gallon as of last Saturday, up from $2.14 a year ago.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConcerned that higher inflation could become its own drag on the economy, central bankers decided it’s time to wind down the stimulus and hope that prices come back down to Earth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Great Unwinding isn’t a US solo album. Central bankers from Australia to Canada have already begun to roll back their pandemic-era stimulus measures as the global economy heals and inflation becomes a threat. Today, the Bank of England could become the first major central bank to raise interest rates following the recession.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nFinance Comes to the Planet's Rescue, Maybe \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCan you save the Earth and make a whole lot of dough while doing it? We’re about to find out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMore than 450 major financial firms have \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/climate-science-business-europe-environment-and-nature-cb368ade2c379ebd616c49e90e3f6b87?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigned on\u003c/a\u003e to the Glasgow Financial Alliance for Net Zero, which abbreviates to the much jollier GFANZ.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe aim is to funnel the alliance’s collective $130 trillion in assets (representing 40% of the world’s capital) into projects that help the globe reach the target set out by the Paris agreement of limiting warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGFANZ is led by former central banker and current UN Climate Envoy Mark Carney, and it will be co-chaired by Mike Bloomberg.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it will work: \u003c/strong\u003eBecause loads of private capital will have to be deployed to help fund the next, say, Tesla. “The gap between what governments have and what the world needs is large,” Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it won’t work: \u003c/strong\u003eEnvironmental nonprofits have hit GFANZ members for being climate hypocrites, saying that donning a cape doesn’t make you a superhero. For instance, global banks have poured \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-02/carney-s-climate-alliance-crests-130-trillion-as-pledges-soar?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$4 trillion\u003c/a\u003e into gas, oil, and coal projects since the 2015 Paris agreement, according to Bloomberg.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: female founders \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/11/03/female-founders-are-making-a-buzzing-venture-backed-comeback/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s also been a record year for women to sell their companies or take them public. Through September, female-founded companies recorded $59 billion in exits.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus, the greatest number of women-led startups hit unicorn status in 2021.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is a hard pivot from last year. Despite the record amount invested by VCs in 2020, female-founded startups saw drops in the number of deals (down 2%) and investment dollars (3%) that closed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo, what changed?\u003c/strong\u003e Did VC funds wake up on January 1 and remember women can run businesses? Prolly not. One indicator might be who’s writing the checks: As of September, roughly 15.4% of general partners at VC firms were women, up from 12% in 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Before you start blasting “Fight Song,” female-founded startups only nabbed about 18% of the $239 billion VC firms shelled out through September.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Their growing obsession with cubes of tungsten, a material admired for its tightly packed particle structure, hit a new high this week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened:\u003c/strong\u003e A group of investors called the TungstenDAO purchased an NFT of a 2-ton (but just over 14 dainty inches) tungsten cube for 56.9 ether, or about $250,000. The NFT comes with the right to visit the cube \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/11/3/22761305/tungsten-cube-meme-nft-crypto-midwest?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonce a year\u003c/a\u003e in its private storage room at the Illinois headquarters of its manufacturer, Midwest Tungsten Service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFrom metal → meme\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMidwest Tungsten Service makes tungsten for industrial uses, but \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/cryptocurrency-enthusiasts-are-obsessed-dense-tungsten-cubes-rcna4283?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estarted selling\u003c/a\u003e small cubes of the metal in 2015 as desktop knickknacks. That soon evolved into a meme when ridiculous \u003ca href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/copypasta/comments/eyqwn9/tungsten_cube_amazon_review/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAmazon reviews\u003c/a\u003e piled up exalting the “intensity of its density.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen, this year, influential crypto investors like Coin Center’s Director of Communications Neeraj K. Agrawal went full magpie on the metal. A few tweets later and Midwest Tungsten Service’s Amazon store sold out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is silly, but we’re not going to underestimate how much value a meme can generate after GameStop, shiba inu coin,
